definitions.definition: the different parts that something is made of; the way in which the different parts are organized

examples.text: the chemical composition of the soil
the composition of the board of directors
the size and composition of an average class
Has household composition changed in the last decade?
Irradiation changes the chemical composition of a spice.
The overall composition of the Senate was Democrats 57 and Republicans 43.
elections to determine the composition of the assembly
the changing composition of the labour force
the character of the state and its internal composition
the ethnic composition of the region
The two drugs are nearly identical in composition.
recent changes in the composition of the workforce

phrases: a change in the composition of something

definitions.definition: a short text that is written as a school exercise; a short essay

examples.text: a composition on the effects of crime
In the exam you will have to do a composition.

definitions.definition: a piece of music or art, or a poem

examples.text: one of Beethoven’s finest compositions
a composition by John Cage
a composition by the sculptor, Bernt Notke
a composition for violin and piano
an original composition by a popular young composer

definitions.definition: the act of composing something, especially a piece of music; the art of writing music

examples.text: pieces performed in the order of their composition
to study composition

definitions.definition: the arrangement of people or objects in a painting or photograph

wordOrigin: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin compositio(n-), from componere ‘put together’.
